etymology.description: 𧶠(𧶠) (lè, "cauldron") = phonetic 𡍬(𡍬) (lù, "pot") + semantic 貝(貝) (bèi, "shell") — a pot made from valuable materials
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 𡍬(𡍬) (lù, "pot") suggests a cooking vessel, while 貝(貝) (bèi, "shell") implies value or precious materials, reflecting the cauldron's importance in cooking.

examples.pinyin: Zhè guō tāng yòng de shì gǔlǎo de 𧶠(𧶠)。
examples.english: This soup pot is made from an ancient cauldron.

examples.chinese: 传说中，仙人使用的𧶠(𧶠)可以煮出长生不老药。
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō zhōng, xiānrén shǐyòng de 𧶠(𧶠) kěyǐ zhǔ chū chángshēngbùlǎoyào。
examples.english: Legend has it that the cauldron used by immortals could brew the elixir of life.
